byline.contributor: Dan Levin contributed reporting from Beijing. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and JANE PERLEZ

abstract: China orders United States military surveillance plane repeatedly to stop flights over contested territory in South China Sea, escalation of dispute between two countries over artificial islands China is building in region.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese are unhappy that the U.S. Navy is watching a huge reclamation project to turn reefs into islands in the Spratly Islands, a group of reefs in the South China Sea.

headline.main: U.S. Flies Over a Chinese Project at Sea, and Beijing Objects
headline.print_headline: China Objects to U.S. Flights Near Artificial Islands

snippet: The Chinese are unhappy that the U.S. Navy is watching a huge reclamation project to turn reefs into islands in the Spratly Islands, a group of reefs in the South China Sea.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
